description:
One year has passed by in the blink of an eye, and it is once again time for us to elect a new SSA Executive Committee! (If you are interested in applying for an exec position, don't forget to check out the details on how to apply at the bottom of this description.)

This will be the final event hosted by the current executive committee, and it has truly been our honour to serve you over the past year.

During this special event, we will be listening to the election speeches from our candidates and voting for next year's exec team. We would like to encourage you to exercise your right to vote and let us know where the club should be headed in the future. We believe that every member of the SSA is important to the club's success, and we welcome your opinions and decisions on which individuals you believe will help lead and improve the club in the following year. 

Don't miss out on this great opportunity to celebrate an awesome year together with the club at our final event! There will be free food (chicken rice!) served for members and wonderful company as usual.

DATE: Friday, March 11th, 6-9pm
LOCATION: The AMS Nest, Performance Theatre (known to some as The Egg)

Price: 
Members: FREE
Non-members: $8

Please RSVP and let us know if you are attending our event!

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

INFORMATION FOR ELECTION CANDIDATES:

Please fill out this application form if you are interested in applying for a position on the executive committee: http://goo.gl/forms/PJw06S7KfX
**Applications are due by March 4th**

Check out the following PDF document for a more detailed description of each position's duties and requirements: https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B_mQx88dKNNkLWlrT1UteTBMTGs/view?usp=sharing

Stay tuned for updates!
name: SSA Elections Night 2016

description:
All UBC Human Resources Management Club members are invited to our Annual General Meeting!

Want to have a say in who runs the club next year? Come out for FREE PIZZA and VOTE for next year’s UBC HRMC President. An online polling link will be available for members who are not able to make it out to the event. 

Date: Wednesday, March 2nd
Time: 5:15pm - 6:00pm
Location: Room 332, Henry Angus Building
Who: All HRMC members

Interested in being President of the UBC Human Resources Management Club for the 2016/2017 academic year? 

You may apply as President or Co-President (if you are applying for Co-President, you must choose a partner and apply together). *** YOU DO NOT NEED TO BE A CURRENT MEMBER OF HRMC TO RUN TO BE PRESIDENT***

To apply, send Candice a statement of interest (300 words maximum for President, 500 words maximum for Co-Presidents) for the position to hrmc.communications@gmail.com before 11:59PM on Monday, February 29th. All candidates must prepare a speech (maximum 5 minutes in length) for voting.

Once a president has been elected, executive positions will be released.

Please direct any questions to hrmc.communications@gmail.com, or shoot us a message directly on Facebook.
name: ANNUAL GENERAL MEETING & HIRING | UBC Human Resources Management Club

description:
It's time for YWiB UBC's Annual General Meeting (AGM) and all members are invited!

Want to have a say in who will be part of YWiB UBC’s executive team next year? Here’s your chance! We have some great candidates eager to share with you their platform. Did we also mention that there will be free food?!

Date: Wednesday, March 9th
Time: 6:00pm – 8:30pm
Location: Room 243, Henry Angus Building
Cost: Free (This event is only open to YWiB UBC members)

FREE FOOD? Your chance to VOTE? What more can you ask for? Come join us in wrapping up a wonderful year!
name: YWiB UBC: Annual General Meeting

description:
As you may know, BC has recently released the Climate Leadership Team recommendations for the province’s Climate Leadership Plan, and has just launched its public consultation on future climate action. This event will include free pizza!

This is indeed an important time for determining future climate action for BC, and the Pacific Institute for Climate Solutions (PICS) at UBC and Common Energy UBC want to help UBC students get informed and involved. As such, we are working together to host a panel session, comprised of three engaged and informed UBC faculty, students, Climate Leadership Team and/or Pembina Institute representatives, on the climate action options for the province. 

We’re aiming to have the session offer student’s a brief overview on the Climate Leadership Team recommendations, as well as other ideas, insight and action that can help position BC as a climate leader. We’d also like the discussion to encourage students to participate in the province’s consultation process.
name: Deciding BC’s Future Climate Action

place.name: Centre for Interactive Research on Sustainability

description:
JOIN UBC BLOOD FOR LIFE, UBC CMSSA, and UBC PERSIAN CLUB NEXT THURSDAY!

♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ Short Description ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥
Stop by our booth to learn how to donate blood to patients (on campus), how to donate to research (also on campus!), how to become a potential stem cell donor and what it means to be a potential stem cell donor (takes only 5-10minutes and a cheek swab! but can make the difference in saving someone's life who is dying of a blood-related disease!) 

OR just stop by to say hi and grab some free cookies/ chocolates! 

We'll be boothing outside of the UBC Bookstore as well in the Buchanan Courtyard between 11 AM - 4:30 PM.

♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ Long Description ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ 

Did you know that every 10 minutes, a person is diagnosed with leukemia? 

Did you also know that signing up to be a potential stem cell donor takes about the same amount of time? 

This is a great oppurtunity for you to learn more about stem cells and blood donations, and sign up to be a potential donor yourself to help save lives around you. If you’ve ever been interested in blood donation or becoming a part of the stem cell registry, or have any questions about the process or how to sign up, this is a great place to start. Our volunteers would love to talk to you more about any questions you may have.

Not interested in stem cell donations? Not to worry, we will also be holding a table to sign up for blood donations with Canadian Blood Services! You won't want to miss it!

"At any given time close to 1,000 Canadians are waiting for a stem cell match - and for a future full of hope." 
-- Canadian Blood Services

Check out some of these links for more information about
Stem cell donations:
https://www.blood.ca/en/stem-cell/donation-process#
https://www.blood.ca/en/stem-cell/myths-about-stem-cell-donation
https://www.blood.ca/en/stem-cell/what-happens-if-im-match

Blood Donations:
https://www.blood.ca/en/blood
https://www.blood.ca/en/blood/who-does-my-donation-help
https://www.blood.ca/en/blood/can-i-donate
name: UBC B4L & CMSSA & PERSIAN CLUB PRESENT: Grand Finale STEM CELL DRIVE

description:
Amnesty International UBC will be hosting its FREE annual conference on March 19th! Come join us to discuss a topical issue in human rights: human migration.

This year's conference will examine topics of human migration around the world, including conflict-induced migration from Syria, undocumented migration in North America, and refugee law and resettlement in Canada. 
___________________________________________________

12:00 – 12:30: Student Speaker
12:30 – 1:10: MOSAIC

2:30 – 2:40: Break
2:40 – 3:20: CARL (subject to change)
3:20 – 3:30: Break
3:30 – 4:00: Interactive workshop with the Social Justice Centre

Stay tuned as we will be updating this event page with additional information regarding this year's Speakers!
___________________________________________________

Event information: 

Where?      Allard Hall, Rm. 105
When?       March 19th: 11:30am (check-in) to 4:00pm
Free Snacks?    Yes! Sushi, pizza, and refreshments will be provided!

For ticketing, you can access our eventbrite page here: https://www.eventbrite.ca/e/humans-without-borders-a-global-perspective-on-migration-tickets-22369894958
name: Humans Without Borders: a Global Perspective on Migration

description:
If you are considering a career in law, come out for free pizza and bring all the questions you have about law school and about Allard School of Law!


We are very fortunate to have 6 Allard Student Ambassadors coming out to provide thorough and candid impressions as well as information about the Allard School of Law to applicants and admitted students, and information that could assist with the transition to law school.


The Student Ambassador Program is designed to assist prospective and admitted students in gathering the necessary information to make an informed decision about applying to or accepting an offer from the Allard School of Law. 


You might wonder:
• what’s law school really like: classes, professors, daily life?
• what career paths are in law
• what truly counts in the admissions process
• how to make your application stand out

This event requires a PSSA membership. If you do not have one we will be selling them at the door! Pizza will be limited so it is first come first serve, max two slices per student. We are keeping the limit on students at 40 so that there can be an effective Ambassador to Student ratio.


#ubcpssa
#allardschooloflaw
name: The PSSA Presents: Pizza with a Law Student

description:
Friends of MSF (Doctors Without Borders) will be hosting an MSF Awareness Week to draw attention to key MSF campaigns and global health issues. 

Come to each day to get free food and get entered into a raffle for a full free PIZZA!

Mon. March 21st @ Abdul Ladha (11-3 pm): A Fair Shot Campaign - http://www.afairshot.org/
Pneumonia causes the death of nearly 1 million children every year. Despite the availability of a vaccine to treat pneumonia, it costs 68x more to immunize a child now in 2016 than it did 15 years ago. Two pharmaceutical companies – Pfizer and GSK – are largely to blame for the significant increase in the cost of these vaccines. The goal of the ‘Fair Shot Campaign’ is to urge Pfizer and GSK to reduce the price of the pneumonia vaccine from $10 to $5. So come out and support the campaign by signing the petition!

Tue. March 22nd @ Abdul Ladha (10-4): Hospital bombings #NotATarget - http://www.msf.ca/NotATarget
We are hosting a Photobooth for the #NotATarget campaign in support of MSF. The campaign originated to stand in solidarity with civilians, patients, medical workers and hospitals who continue to be targeted victims of attacks by armed groups around the world; To highlight the horrific consequences of targeted attacks on people; and To demand the right of humanitarian workers to provide humanitarian care to people in need, particularly in conflict zones. Participants are also invited to sign a petition with us condemning such attacks.

Wed. March 23rd @ The Nest (10-4 pm): World Tuberculosis (TB) Day - https://msfaccess.org/TBmanifesto/
World TB Day strives to raise awareness about the severe lack of accessible treatment to TB in third-world countries as the rise of muti-drug resistant TB continues. Affecting more than 12 million people worldwide, it is essential for us to be aware of the need of proper distribution of TB treatment and diagnosis as TB becomes harder and harder to control and cure.

Thu. March 24th @ The Nest (9-6 pm): Malnutrition Tent - http://www.msf.ca/en/malnutrition
Poor nutrition causes nearly half (45%) of deaths in children under fiver (3.1 million per year). Want to learn how people get assessed for malnutrition in the field? Come and participate in our simulated assessment and learn about the signs of malnutrition. Thursday, 24th at the Nest from 9-6pm
name: FoMSF presents: MSF Awareness Week 2016

owner.name: Friends of Médecins Sans Frontières UBC

description:
This event qualifies for 25 IPE points!

For the coming Spring QuIPs conference on March 19, IHI UBC is excited to be working in collaboration with the BC Patient Safety & Quality Council to bring you the "Change Agent Workshop Series".

For students who have always wanted to learn how to step out of their comfort zone to become a leader, how do you make that transition from a participant to taking on a leadership role? As a leader, how can you lead differently to shift the mindset of leadership to effectively engage your team to harness individual collective energy? For those entering the professional workplace, what are the relevant skills you need in tackling the barriers you may encounter?

As the future leaders of tomorrow, let's start planting the necessary seeds to develop effective communication strategies and to build relationships that stress the importance of collaborative input in initiating change.

This will be an exciting and engaging opportunity for students interested in mobilizing to improve quality of care as well as learning the skills to become an effective change agent to do it. Free admission and lunch/refreshments will be provided.

Schedule of Events
9:00am-9:30am Registration
9:30am-9:35am Welcome from IHI UBC
9:35am-10:30am Towards Possibilities: Being an Organizational Change Agent
11:00-12:30pm The Glue that Holds It Together: The Importance of Community and Building Alliances
12:30pm-1:00pm Lunch Break
1:00pm-1:45pm Saddle Up!: Harnessing the Power of Resistance
1:45pm-2:45pm Keep the Fire Burning: Motivation and Maintaining Energy for Change

We're looking forward to seeing you at our Workshop Series this year.
name: Spring QuIP Change Agent Workshop Series

owner.name: Institute for Healthcare Improvement Open School: UBC Chapter

description:
Our first panel event of 2016 will be held on the evening of March 8th in PHRM 1101 (Pharmaceutical Sciences Building), centring on end-of-life care. We will be exploring end-of life care with an emphasis on how to minimize suffering for both the patient and the family, and how to ensure dignity is maintained.

We will feature four different talks: (1) navigating options in end-of-life care, (2) a family member’s perspective on end of life, (3) optimizing care to support both patients and their family caregivers, and (4) a primer on how to talk to patients about end of life.

Speakers include Dr. Jennifer Kryworuchko (Associate Professor, School of Nursing, UBC), Joyce Sandercock (Patient Voices Network ), Dr. Kelli Stajduhar (Professor, School of Nursing and Centre on Aging, UVic), and Dr. Pippa Hawley (Division Head of Palliative Care, UBC).

Students in professional health disciplines like audiology, dental hygiene, dietetics and pharmacy will receive 25 Exposure Level Interprofessional Education (IPE) points.

Refreshments will be provided.
name: A Pragmatic Approach to Respectful End-of-Life Care

owner.name: Institute for Healthcare Improvement Open School: UBC Chapter

description:
Join us at old sub party room for the New Year Countdown Ceremony and a fun night!

This year, the magical Persian New Year festival of Norouz is coming to the heart of our campus at UBC!! We plan to countdown on March 19th, at the turn of the Persian New Year (that is 9:30:12 PM to put exactly!). We will celebrate the blossoming of spring  around a beautiful Haft-Seen table and the company of you beautiful people. So join us for a night filled with Persian music and dance, refreshments, finger food and pastries, Persian style tea and of course a warm environment to hang out with family and friends.

Dress code: Semi-formal to formal encoraged.
Finger food, Persian pastries, tea and other refreshments will be provided. 

***Kick off @ 8:00 pm
***countdown @ 9:30:12 pm 
*** party all night long 

نوروز امسال، قصد داریم تا لحظه تحویل سال در خارج از ایران زمین جاودانه شود. بهار را با دانشجویان دانشگاه بریتیش کلمبیا شروع کنید تا در کنار هم چشم به سالی‌ سبز داشته باشیم. شادمانه به استقبال بهار می‌رویم, کنار سفره هفت سین، رو به آینده‌.
name: UBCPC: 1395 Nowruz Countdown Party

description:
As a member of the UBC Accounting Club, you are invited to our annual general meeting (AGM) on Tuesday, March 8th!

We will be wrapping up the term with free food! We will also be voting for our next President, Vice President, and Treasurer! Come out and hear our candidates' platforms and vote for who you want to see run the club next year!

When: Tuesday, March 8th

Where: HA 295

Time: 1:00 pm - 2:00 pm

Cost: Free (This event is only open to members!)

RSVP: UBC Accounting Club Newsletter, 6:00pm on Saturday, March 5th. 

The UBC Accounting Club is currently accepting nominations for its President, Vice-President, and Treasurer positions! Learn more about these elected roles and be the face of the Club for the 2016-2017 academic year!

Nominations are due on Saturday, March 5th at 10 PM and voting will occur on March 8th at 1 PM. You must be a member to run for Vice-President or Treasurer and have 1 year of experience on the UBC Accounting Club executive team to run for President!

Job Description & Application Form: https://drive.google.com/folderview?id=0Bw8CNqpniO9_YkRpdWZxamdtSW8&usp=sharing
name: UBC Accounting Club Annual General Meeting

description:
The African Business Club presents its second social event this semester! Hosted by the Geopolitics and Finance Directors, this event aims to amalgamate issues concerning boarder security in western Africa and African business success stories. 

If you’re looking for a relaxed ease into a hectic week ahead, break from a long Monday or just a genuinely intriguing discussion and good company, this is the event for you! During the evening you’ll have the opportunity to watch specific handpicked videos, participate in thought-provoking discussions and engage first-hand with current issues of extreme global importance. Snacks and refreshments will also be available!

Let us entertain you on Monday evening! Looking forward to seeing you at the Global Lounge. 


Theme: Engaging with current geopolitical and financial issues in Africa. 

Two topics: 
	•	The issue of security in west Africa and its affect on cross-border relations
	•	African success stories and the role of financing 

Location:		 Global Lounge 
Date: 		Monday, 7 March 
Time: 			6pm 

AND FREE FOOD!!! :D
name: The African paradigm: Security issues and Success stories

description:
The inaugural EUS Spring Conference will be day long conference will feature workshops on professional development, diversity in engineering and volunteer training to UBC Engineering Students! These workshops will be facilitated by UBC Engineering Students. Many of these students represented UBC Engineering at various conferences throughout this past year. This conference is a chance for members of the EUS, department clubs, ex-officio clubs, and students-at-large to connect and share their experiences.

The conference will take place on March 19th from 9am-4:30pm in the Engineering Student Centre with workshops in Kaiser and CEME.

If you would like to volunteer, sign up here https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1vAPPSSw4c9g7_EjYn7O-XyFwgf2136eXGHhwcCcHInA/viewform

Registration is free and includes a free lunch! Learn more at: ubcengineers.ca/springconference
name: EUS Spring Conference

description:
The Eating Sustainably  will showcase, educate and encourage students to support local food products that tie in the idea of sustainability. 

The Sustainability Ambassadors will host a hot-lunch provided by the finest UBC catering services (Westcadia, AMS Food Services, Agora and Sprouts) and other food products from a wide range of sponsors. The lunch will use ingredients that are grown or raised in an ecologically and ethically responsible manner, using practices that protect the environment, safeguard human health, ensure humane treatment of farm animals and provide fair treatment to workers. Funds raised from this event will be donated to the AMS food bank.

Cost: $2 (all proceeds will be donated the AMS Food Bank).

Enjoy an entrée, main course and desert at this interactive event where attendees will have to interact with at least one to two booths in order to obtain their food course!

Photo Credit: Martin Dee / UBC Communications & Marketing
name: Eating Sustainably for Wellbeing

description:
Are you currently looking for a co-op work placement? Are you nervous about looking for your first work placement? 
Are you looking to polish your interview skills for a challenging interview?
Are you looking forward to having experienced co-op students give you advice on your cover letter or resume? 

Science Co-op Students Associations (SCOOPS) will be hosting a three-in-one package to help you! We will offer one on one resume, cover letter and mock interview workshops for all those currently applying for science co-op jobs or are interested.

We will have SPECIFIC industry/job targeted questions to help you bring on your A game to the real interview. 

**Refreshments will be provided. Availability is on first come first serve basis. **

DRESS CODE: Business casual
FREE membership at event!

To get the most out of this workshop, please RSVP by using the link below and indicate what kind of job you are interested in, it will help our facilitators a long way to better prepare for a personalized workshop!

Link: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1pyUO13jY8p_YIulf5Ot43_G0THINSnf3zgsGhJWTf-w/viewform?c=0&w=1&usp=mail_form_link

Looking forward to seeing you soon!
name: UBC SCOOPS 3-In-1 Workshop: Resume, CL Review + MOCK Interviews

name: NATIONAL COOP WEEK

description:
All students who vote will receive FREE BURGER at the Civil Club BBQ on March 18 at 11:00 am at the EDC Courtyard. Students must vote prior to getting free food. Voting is for the new Civil Club Executive and Professors of the Year!

Students on co-op don't need to worry as there will be online ballots avaliable which will be e-mailed. Civil merchandise will also be available for purchase during the event. We have shirts, toques, patches, stickers, sun glasses and pins!
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - 

Want to get involved in the UBC Civil Engineering Club? Now is your chance! The Civil Club is looking for enthusiastic students who want to make a positive change in their community! Civil Club Elections 2016 are held in March with voting on March 18 when all civil undergrads vote to elect 6 executives and 9 ex-officio positions.


*Nominations Open - Friday, March 4 at 11:59 PM
*Nominations Close - Friday, March 11 at 4:00 PM
*Candidates Meetings (Optional) - March 11 - 4:00 PM
*Campaigning Starts - Friday, March 12 at 12:01 AM
*Voting Starts - Friday March 18 12:01 AM 
*Voting & Campaigning Close - Friday March 18 12:59 PM

Nomination forms will be made avaliable online when nominations open. Available positions are listed below with a brief description. Still got questions? Ask any of the current executives! You can also check out our website (http://ubccec.com/) or send the presidents an email at president@ubccec.com.

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - 
EXECUTIVE POSITIONS:

**PRESIDENT**
The President is in charge of overseeing all club activities. They are in charge of being the liaison between the civil student body and the Engineering Undergraduate Society (EUS) and Civil Engineering Department.

**VICE-PRESIDENT**
The Vice President operates as second-in-command to the President. They are responsible for overseeing club activities and providing additional support to the President as needed.

**TREASURER**
The Club Treasurer is responsible for planning and preparing an annual budget for the club, as well as handling finances over the course of the year.

**SOCIAL COORDINATOR**
The Social Coordinator is responsible for leading the club's social events, with the goal of increasing interactions amongst civil students, students of other departments, and faculty members.

**SECRETARY**
The Secretary is responsible for taking and distributing meeting minutes from the weekly Civil Club meetings.

**PUBLICITY REPRESENTATIVE**
The Publicity Rep in charge of social media and publicity for all civil club events. Primary responsibilities include managing the facebook page, creating and distributing posters, and making class announcements. 

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - 
EX-OFFICIO POSITIONS:

**ACADEMIC REPRESENTATIVE**
The Academic Rep is responsible for coordinating additional exam preparation tutorial sessions and communicating all students' academic concerns to the department.

**THIRD YEAR REPRESENTATIVE**
Responsible for conveying information between the 3rd Year class and the Civil Club. They share club updates with their class, and their class' questions, feelings, and suggestions with the club.

**GRAD REPRESENTATIVE(S)**
The Grad Rep(s) are responsible for conveying information between the 4th Year class and the Civil Club. They are also in charge of fundraising for grad events, play a role in planning the Iron Ring ceremony, dinner, and after-party at the end of the year, and organize the annual Grad Trip.

**SPORTS REPRESENTATIVE**
The Sports Rep is responsible for coordinating civil sports teams, including intramural and EUS-event sports teams.

**E-WEEK REPRESENTATIVE**
The E-Week Rep is responsible for overseeing civil involvement in all E-Week events, including promoting events to civil students, attending EUS-hosted E-Week prep meetings, coordinating participation and team involvement, and overseeing event attendence. E-Week preparations begin the first week of January, and E-Week is held in the first full week of February.

**DESIGN STUDIO & LOFT MANAGER**
The Design Studio and Loft Manager is in charge of taking care of the Design Studio and the Loft. They work for the general betterment of both spaces, including replacing, re-stocking, and managing services like the Design Studio printer and the Loft's vending machines.

**UNDERGROUND EDITOR**
The Underground Editor is in charge of creating and distributing our monthly department newsletter, the Civil Underground, which contains news, faculty and club updates, and details about upcoming events.

**WEBMASTER**
The Webmaster is in charge of updating and maintaining the club website.

**MERCHANDISE REPRESENTATIVE**
The Merchandise Rep is in charge of the ordering, marketing and sales of club paraphernalia, including jackets, hats, patches, pins and t-shirts.
name: Civil Club Elections & BBQ 2016
